strIntroduction: The Pirates of Tokyo Bay perform improv comedy, like the TV show Whose Line is it Anyway?, but more fun because it`s live in front of you, unrehearsed and unedited. We have been performing in Japan since 2005 in both Osaka and Tokyo. We have even toured China (Beijing and Hong Kong). Our shows are always different because they are based on audience suggestions! So come to a show, bring some friends and be part of a show that was created by your ideas!! And unlike many other comedy shows in Tokyo, this one is performed in both English and Japanese, so you can brush up on your language skills while you`re laughing. (Fee includes entrance fee and 2 beers. Special seats upfront are provided if asked too!)
strTitle: Watch a Live Improv Comedy Show in English and Japanese

strIntroduction: Want to try something relaxing? Then try Calligraphy. Calligraphy is not just writing. It's about expressing yourself with words.Works written by rubbed India ink lasts 100 years, making it something of a memento - a great souvenir. In this activity, you will.. • Write “kanji” (Chinese character) to express your feelings. The Kanji itself has meaning. Later when you see that kanji you wrote, you’ll remember how you felt at that moment you wrote it. So come and enjoy a luxurious time that helps you find your inner self. We will help you decide which kanji suits you the most!
strTitle: Express Your Feelings with Japanese Calligraphy: Shodo

strIntroduction: In this activity you can join a Bonsai workshop and visit a Bonsai garden in Suzaka city, Nagano. As an option, you can book an overnight stay at our guest house. 1. Bonsai Work Shop Join the Bonsai workshop for 2-3 hours. Yamamoto-san will teach you on a private basis. We will take you to her Bonsai garden by car. 2. Visit Iura-san's Bonsai garden You can visit Iura-san's bonsai garden. He is one of the famous Bonsai artists in Japan. 3. Stay at Guest House KURA. Enjoy staying in a traditional Japanese house.
strTitle: Join a Bonsai Experience Tour near Nagano

strIntroduction: Make original Wagashi sweets in Osaka! Wagashi is a type of Japanese sweets popular in Japan's culture. Japanese people enjoy the 4 seasons with various items among which is Wagashi. First, the local craftsman will make 12 different Wagashi in front of us, and teach us about how to express Japan's 4 seasons through Wagashi. Next, you can make 4 or 5 Wagashi. Finally, you can eat your Wagashi with green tea. The activity can start form 13 pm or 15pm. The contents of the activity is the same.
strTitle: Make Wagashi sweets and drink green tea in Osaka!

strIntroduction: In Ueno's Monkey Bar you can spend a great night with local dishes using Japanese ingredients! In addition, you can play with the Squirrel monkeys! This is a reservation for the popular "Monkey course". It consists of 5 dishes, and 2-hour all-you-can-drink. The food includes: 1) original salad. 2) canape with cream cheese and salmon. 3) baby back ribs. 4) fried chicken (drum or wind tips). 5) original taco rice. The food's volume is sufficient for an adult male. If you have allergy for some foods, please tell us in advance. We will try to adjust the menu. The "all-you-can-drink" plan means that you can choose drinks written in a dedicated menu within 2 hours with no additional payment. The menu includes beer, whiskey, shochu, cocktails and non-alcohol drinks. You will get a chance to give food to the monkeys too! Please enjoy the Tokyo night with your friends, family, lover and the monkeys! :) ATTENTION: If you order drinks, please order 1 drink per 1 order. If you come before 22:00, children (under the age 18) can enter our bar. * 1 or more adult (over the age 20) is needed as a guardian. * Minors under the age of 18 cannot choose the Monkey course, but they can choose and order non-alcohol drinks and all foods written in our menu (please pay the billing at our bar before you leave). After 22:00, only guests over 18 can enter our bar. If you take picture of the monkeys, please do not use flash. If you give foods to the monkeys directly, you have to disinfect your hand (we have supplies for that). INFORMATION: You can book the course from 2 people (minimum) We're looking forward to meeting you!
strTitle: Enjoy playing with Squirrel monkeys at a bar in Ueno, Tokyo

strIntroduction: A cherry blossom cruise is surely the ultimate way to experience the quintessential Japanese springtime past-time of hanami (sakura viewing)! Join this all-inclusive tour and enjoy a gourmet lunch at one of Japan's best tempura restaurants 'Tempura Kondo'; then board the cruiser and float away down the Sumida River; finally to the historical area of Asakusa, filled with temples and historical treasures. While it's hard to predict the exact blooming time, it usually occurs during the first weeks of April every year. What better way to enjoy this natural phenomenon than from the comfort of a premium cruiser on the Sumidagawa? Itinerary - 13:00 Depart from Mitsukoshi Isetan department store in Nihonbashi, - Tokyo. - 13:30-15:00 Indulge in the legendary tradition at one of the best Tempura joints in the world at Tempura Kondo. - 16:25 Depart Odaiba Pier and enjoy a premium cruiser tour on the Sumida River where you can admire the blossoming cherry trees. - 17:10 Arrive at Asakusa's Nitenmon Pier and freely explore Asakusa Temple and other attractions in the area by yourself. - 19:35 Departure via Tokyo Station. - 19:45 Conclude the tour at Mitsukoshi Isetan Department store. Celebrate the arrival of Spring 2017 in style and join this tour for unforgettable memories of Japan!
strTitle: Lunch at Tempura Kondo & Relax on a Cherry Blossom Cruise

strIntroduction: You’ve likely heard of the famous maid cafes of Akihabara, but have you heard of a maid salon? The lovely and fun ladies help make your trip unforgettable. The Royal Head Spa Experience Our model is first greeted by stylists as he comes through the door and is whisked away to the equivalent of his throne－his salon chair. After reviewing the service details, our model is led to the sink to begin his head spa treatment. She selects a mousse shampoo from a line called “MoeMoe” by Japanese brand and begins massaging his scalp. He is able to relax as she takes great care to thoroughly treat and massage his scalp, and the clean and natural smell of the shampoo fills the room. After rinsing, the two move back to the salon chair while the stylist examines our model’s hair type. She decides that on an oil-type treatment and begins massaging. The treatment is then left in the hair for a bit while our model’s neck, shoulders, and upper back are pampered with a massage. Hand Massage and Souvenir Photo After the massage is finished, the stylist leads our model back to the sink for one more rinse plus a scalp massage. After the head spa is complete, the maid stylist dries and styles our model’s hair to his liking. To finish the service, two stylist carefully roll up our model’s sleeves and ask him to choose a scent. After choosing his favorite, the pair carefully apply the lotion and massage his hands and arms. The three are able to enjoy a nice conversation about his home country and have a mini language exchange. Finally, our model poses with his stylist and takes an instant-developing photo. While he checks out, the stylist writes him a special, customized message on the photo. He takes the souvenir photo with a smile on his face and thanks the staff for their wonderful hospitality. A Note for Cosplayers If you’re interested in cosplaying, the maid stylist as can create custom wigs for any character you choose. The price and time needed to finish each wig differs depending on the length and style, so please bring a photo to the staff if you are interested! Also, international shipping is possible for an additional fee, making this a great way to receive a professionally styled, customized wig even when you’ve returned home.
strTitle: Head Spa with Cosplaying Maids in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Their service philosophy is to make their valued customers feel at home, and the warm welcome our model received when entering the salon was a clear indication that the experience was going to be a fun and comfortable one. With little information about this type of salon, he was really curious and excited about the whole experience. Eyebrow Cut and Trim The service started with an eyebrow cut and trim, the first professional one for our model. He was pleasantly surprised at the skill and efficiency of the stylist – proving that grooming services are not only about a subculture experience, but their stylists are also highly-qualified professionals who want to give their customers the best service possible. Double Massage Shampoo, Shoulder Massage and Hand Massage Next in the lineup of services was the massage shampoo which drained away any tension he had. Other great benefits of a shampoo massage include effective scalp exfoliation and the promotion of healthy hair growth. The shoulder massage – the best part of the service for our model – included a deep massage of the head and neck as well, and he was very surprised at how powerful the petite stylist's massage was. He also loved their lighthearted conversation, and was happy that it wasn't a role play situation as one might expect in this type of salon. The massage service concluded with a hand massage with our model's choice of orange massage cream. Maid Salon Memory This is one salon experience that our model never wants to forget, and he was delighted that he could get a photo with the maid stylists as a memory of his travels to Tokyo. Moesham welcomes male and female customers to try out their services - why not give them a try and make your own Tokyo memories there?
strTitle: Grooming Service by Maid Stylists in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this activity you can have a private photo session with a real Kyoto maiko (geisha apprentice) at scenic locations which are usually not open to the general public. English interpretation is included. After the photo session, you can have Japanese sweets and communicate with the maiko! Below are the details of this exclusive experience: Gather at Gion at 15:00 pm. We will then move to the scenic location together with the maiko. It will take 10-20 minutes by car. The photo session will take about 45-60 minutes. You can have various photos together with the maiko against the landscape of beautiful gardens and traditional buildings. After the photo session, we will go to a cafe if there is time and will eat Japanese sweets. Our interpreter (in English or Chinese) will help you communicate with the maiko. The activity will finish at Gion at 17:00 pm. In case of bad weather, we will make indoor photos. As an option, you can book the professional photographer service. In this case you will receive the photos by Google Photo within 2 hours. Note that the main option does not include a private photographer (you will be making the photos yourself). You can also extend the session with 60 minutes at an additional price.
strTitle: Take photos with a real Kyoto maiko at scenic locations

strIntroduction: Kawazu zakura as they are known in Japanese are a special kind of cherry blossoms that can be seen from early February to early March. They have big petals and a dark pink color. More than 8,000 Kawazu sakura trees grace the town of Kawazu in the Izu peninsula, two hours and a half away from Tokyo. The area is also famous for their onsen, waterfalls and breathtaking nature. Visitors who come to Kawazu during the time of the Kawazu cherry blossoms that last for about a month, can admire the beautiful lighting events that are prepared for the Kawazu zakura festival. This tour will allow you to enjoy the best of the Kawazu zakura festival while pampering yourself in a onsen resort and trying delicious food. Here is the schedule for the tour. February 28th 12:00pm Meet at Mitsukoshi department store, in Shinbashi, Tokyo and get on a comfortable luxury bus that will drive you two hours and a half to Tofuya Resort & Spa-Izu at Yoshina onsen. 3:00pm Arrival at Tofuya Resort & Spa-Izu. Enjoy the place before indulging in a luxurious Kaiseki meal, the highest from of Japanese culinary art. You will also have the opportunity to soak in the onsen and spending the night at this beautiful resort. March 1st 10:45am Depart Tofuya Resort & Spa-Izu 11:45am Arrive at Kawazu to admire this special kind of cherry blossoms and enjoy walking along the Kawazu river lined with more than 8,000 trees of Kawazu zakura. You'll also have the opportunity to visit the local attractions such as the 60 year old original Kawazu tree and different natural spots of the area. (90 minutes) 13:45pm Right about when your stomach starts feeling light, you will be taken to Izu Imahama Tokyo Hotel where you will indulge in delicious Teppanyaki cuisine. (90 minutes) 4:30pm For dessert, nothing like juicy strawberries freshly hand-picked by yourself at Otomi farm, the last stop in this tour. (30 minutes) 8:00pm Estimated arrival time to Tokyo Station. Welcome Spring this year a little earlier, and pamper yourself with this luxury tour that offers you amazing cuisine, the ultimate relaxation at the onsen, and the quintessential Japanese landscapes: beautiful cherry blossoms.
strTitle: Admire Kawazu cherry blossoms in style in an onsen resort!

strIntroduction: Harvest vegetables in a rural field near Osaka and eat a meal using the cooked vegetables (ex. BBQ, Nabe-mono, Mochitsuki..and so on)! Move to the field by bus in 10 minutes and walk 5 minutes. First, the farmer will talk about the vegetables and the history of Ikeda area around the field. And then, we'll harvest some vegetable and cook them there! Some children and parents living around there also come to the event, so you can communicate with them and probably make friends with them! 8:30 Gather at Hankyu Ikeda Station 9:00 Arrive at the field 10:00 Start the activity 11:30 End the activity 12:00 Break up at Ikeda Station ※After this event, you can go around famous spots (Instant Ramen museum, Mino city, etc). If you would like me to take you to some spots after the event, please tell me. ※we can get different vegetable in different seasons (ex. pea, okura, turnip, cauliflower, cabbage, cucumber, soybean, radish, eggplant, garlic, bell pepper, broccoli, spinach, lettuce, green onion, sweat potato) If you want to know what you can get in this season, please contact us!
strTitle: Have a breakfast in the field & make Japanese friends, Osaka

strIntroduction: Go to Ikeda Gofukuza, and watch the professional show before trying to dance "Nihon Buyo" (Japanese traditional dances) yourself! First, we will gather at Hankyu Ikeda station. Next, we'll move to Ikeda Gofukuza and watch performances for the masses. After the end, the manager of the theater will tell us about the history of "Gofukuza". The language will be Japanese, but we will have an interpreter, so you can to ask some questions!!! After that, we'll learn about "Nihon Buyo" dances. The players will teach us famous and easy dances. And we'll dance to the music together! Let's make friends with local Japanese people through the dance. 14:30 Gather at Hankyu Ikeda station 14:50 Arrive at Ikeda Gofukuza 15:00 Watch "Nihon Buyo" 15:45 Take pictures (You can take a picture with players) 16:00 The manager teaches us about the history of Gofkuza and Japanese dances 16:10 Dance together 17:00 End Capacity: 15 people
strTitle: Let's Dance "Nihon Buyo" and make Japanese friends, Osaka

strIntroduction: In this tour, we will visit Taishakuten Sando (shopping street), Taishakuten temple, Buddhist sculpture gallery and a Japanese garden in the nostalgic Shibamata area in Tokyo. Here is our itinerary: - 9:00 Meeting at your hotel -10:00 Shibamata Station -10:00-11:00 Taishakuten-Sando (Shopping Street) & Taishakuten temple (sculpture gallery and Japanese garden) -11:05-12:00 “Torasan” museum -12:15-13:00 Lunch at “Toroku” (Okonomiyaki restaurant)
strTitle: Explore the nostalgic and local Tokyo at “Shibamata” area

strIntroduction: Tokyo's Trick Art Museum in Odaiba offers 3D artworks and optical illusions. Have fun at the “Edo Area” created for the first time in the world, the “Haunted Mansion with Funny Japanese Monsters” and “Trick Art Gallery” with the best collections of arts. Be sure to bring your camera! This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Visit Tokyo's Trick Art Museum with local people

strIntroduction: Japan Sake and Shochu Information Center is established for the purpose of making all the people in the world know about the charm of Japanese sake, shochu and awamori including the history and the culture by “Seeing,” “Touching,” and “Experiencing.” 1. Museum First, a big wooden tub on the ceiling will catch your eyes. The wall is decorated by glass origin material of modern Japanese color which images the traditional lacquer ware, red and black. Nice and slow atmosphere waits for you with fresh woody fragrance. In the wooden exhibition cabinet, there are variety of sake vessels from all over Japan for you to enjoy the beauty of Japanese culture. There are two TV monitors and two projectors to show you videos contents on sake and shochu. For those who want to know more about sake, there are tablets for you to freely refer to the information on the topic. Other than that, we provide real ingredients of sake and shochu, real Koji, and other interesting and rare materials. See and imagen sake brewing process. 2. Concierge We gather the newest information about sake. Information about the tour to visit nice breweries which have English translator, information about the sake events held every day in many places in Tokyo area, about the shops where you can buy good sakes. We as a concierge of sake, answer your questions. 3. Tasting You can always taste about 50 items of Japanese sake, shochu, and awamori. Sake include various types such as Daiginjo, Junmai-ginjo, Junmai, Aged sake, Sparkling sake, etc. from all over Japan for minimum price of 100 JPY per cup. Shochu made from different ingredients such as sweet potato, barley, rice, and brown sugar can be tasted as well. Awamori is another special spirit from Okinawa, and you can also enjoy tasting. For those who have difficulty in choosing, we provide sets of three different types of sake and shochu. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Visit Japan Sake and Shochu Information Center with locals

strIntroduction: MEGA WEB is the car theme park to see, ride and feel automobiles. There are 3 facilities based on each theme. Explore TOYOTA's theme park with your family, couples and friends. 1. Gigantic space with about sixty TOYOTA current model cars display. Go for a test drive and witness TOYOTA's newest models we never displayed in other location in "TOYOTA CITY SHOWCASE". You can also learn about the technologies of hybrid, safety and environment of TOYOTA. Not only look around the car, but open the door and get in the car. You can check the actual car specifications. Enjoy our exciting events as well. 2.The Ride Studio is for children to enjoy driving experience and learn about some traffic rules. The studio consists of two sections. “Indoor Ride One” has a 230-meter long course where children (aged 6 to 18) enjoy three different types of cars called ‘Camatte’, ‘Pius’, and ‘Kids hybrid car’. “Petit Ride One” is for preschool-age children (aged 3 to 5). ※There are requirements (weight and height restrictions) that must be met. 3. The history of cars The “History garage” is a place where historic cars of all over the world gathered. This place has different sections where you enjoy the history of motorsport, and master’s work on car repair. Enjoy our mini-car shop and a fancy café. I will take you to one of them (#1, #2 or #3 with local people. You can also stay longer with local people after this tour.) This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Look, Ride, Feel Cars in a Theme Park with locals, Tokyo

strIntroduction: The Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route connects Toyama city in Toyama prefecture with Omachi town in Nagano prefecture and is part of the Northern Japan Alps. It is traversed by different means of transportation including cablecars, trolley buses and a ropeway. It's popular for the magnificent scenery of the Tateyama Mountain Range, which is located within the Chubu Sangaku National Park. Among its most notable sights are the Kurobe Dam, the snow wall at Murodo, and the endless hiking and trekking trails for the more experienced mountaineers. In this 2-day tour departing from Tokyo you will be able to see not only the Snow Walls of the Tateyama Kurobe Alpen Route, but also visit the traditional old town Tateyama and the UNESCO World Heritage Site - the picturesque rural village Shirakawago! Itinerary: Day 1: - 7:50 am (7:00 am on Apr 29, 6:50 am on May 3, 4, 5): Meet and depart by bus from Shinjuku, Tokyo - enjoy shopping at Nyukawa (30 min) - stroll around the old streets of Takayama known as "Little Kyoto" (60 min) - walk around Shirakawago village (60-90 min) - stay overnight in Toyama Day 2: - Take the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route using a combination of various exciting vehicles! (all day) - arrive at Azumino and enjoy shopping (25 min) - 19:30 - 20:00 pm: return to Shinjuku and end of tour Note: Only breakfast on Day 2 is provided. Please arrange your own meals or bring lunch boxes for the bus. You can optionally buy a lunch box for Day 1. Choose between: - Japanese variety boxed lunch of Delicacies in Shinshu area : 1050 JPY - "Miso Dengaku" ("Konnyaku" yam cake with miso spread) boxed lunch : 850 JPY Or please let us know until 5 days prior to the departure. The money will be collected by your tour conductor on the day. If you don't order this option, please buy lunch by yourself at the service area etc on the way. This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: See the Snow Walls of Tateyama Alpine Route and Shirakawago!

strIntroduction: The winter night illuminations of UNESCO World Heritage Site Shirakawago village are one of the most anticipated seasonal events in Gifu prefecture, Japan. The amazing illuminations are only on for a few days per year, so don't miss out! In this comfortable and convenient 2-day bus tour departing from Tokyo you can see the lit up village and stroll the old streets of the traditional city Hida-Furukawa. In addition, you will be able to shop around Hirayu and see the beautiful snowy landscape of Japan's Tateyama mountains! Brief information about the destinations: - Shirakawago: This is a World Heritage "gassho-zukuri" farmhouse village. Hundreds and thousands of tourists come to visit the village for its unique scenery, especially in the winter when snow covers the village and gives it a magical quality that is further enhanced by the winter illuminations lighting up the Ogamachi area. - Hida Furukawa: A small picturesque town known for its quiet and rural atmosphere that has retained many of the traditional old spirit of Japan. The town is known for its many craftsmen and local ateliers, offering experiences in wood-making, candle making, dyeing, and more. Itinerary: Day 1 - 10:10 am: Meeting and departure by bus from Shinjuku, Tokyo - visit Shirakawago and see the winter illuminations (180 min) - go to Toyama and stay overnight at a city hotel Day 2 - visit Shinminato area for shopping (40 min) - drive along the snow-capped Tateyama mountain range over Shin-Minato Ohashi Bridge - visit Hida-Furukawa and stroll around the city (50 min) - see Hirayu Otaki Fall (40 min) - shop at Hirayu (30 min) - 19:00-19:30 pm: return to Shinjuku and end of tour ※ The amount of snow is variable, depending on weather conditions. ※ In Shirakawago, there is no shuttle bus service to the observatory during the illuminations. When you go, it takes around 30~40 minutes from the parking lot by walking. The road to the observatory might be closed owing to heavy snow or other weather conditions. ※This tour includes only breakfast on the second day and does not do other meals. Please buy individually at the service areas on the way or order optional meals your tour director will offer during the tour. You will have it on the bus travelling. There is no time to have meals at restaurants during the tour. ※ Optional lunch box is available for Day 1: - Chicken Rice Bento Box: 1000 JPY - Tochigi Shimofuri-Kougen Gyumeshi (beef on rice): 1200 JPY If you wish to have optional lunch box, please let us know at least 2 days prior to the departure date. Please pay the lunch fee to the tour staff by cash on the tour date. Please eat lunch in the bus. If you do not wish for the optional lunch box, please buy your lunch at the service area on the way. This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Last Chance Shirakawago Winter Illuminations, from Tokyo

strIntroduction: Enjoy transforming yourself into Maiko or Oiran with this photo studio package in Osaka! We are currently offering Maiko and Oiran transformation and photo shoots programs at Studio NADESHIKO, a luxurious photo studio in Shinsaibashi, Osaka, for a special price! Studio NADESHIKO is famous for its high quality photo shoots programs, offering great collections of kimono, furisode, and Oiran costumes. It also offers beautiful backgrounds and professional hair styling and makeup service as well, so you can just come to the studio with empty hands! There are two packages available for reservations, which are: Oiran Course - Oiran Costume (1 set) - Hair Styling & Makeup - Fitting - Photo shoots at the studio - 200 poses & photo data - 2L size photo (printed, 1 piece) Maiko Course - Kimono (1 set) - Hair Styling & Makeup - Fitting - Photo shoots at the studio - 2L size photos (printed, 2 pieces) & photo data (3 pieces) The cameraman will help you with the poses, so you will look like the real Oiran and Maiko in the photos. The studio also has very beautiful backdrops and decorations for the photo shoot sessions, which you can choose before the photo shoot session starts. Transform yourself into an Oiran or Maiko at a special price only with this program!
strTitle: Discounted Oiran or Maiko Photo Studio Packages in Osaka!

strIntroduction: Participate in this program and enjoy the most beautiful Japanese traditional arts performance in Kyoto! Maiko Theater is located within 5-minute walk from Miyagawacho in Kyoto, where you can enjoy breathtaking performance of Japanese traditional dance performed by the beautiful Maiko. If you are visiting Kyoto for the first time, visiting Maiko Theater is a must, as you can enjoy the deeper part of Kyoto there. Watch the Buyo dance, a Japanese traditional dance originated from Kyoto, while seeing the mystical beauty of the Maiko dancers. Depending on the program that you choose, you can also enjoy eating Japanese lunch box, delicious snacks, and Japanese sake while watching the Maiko dancers dancing on the stage as well! We are currently offering three different programs with different contents as follows: Wareshinobu Course (12:00-13:30): - Buyo Dance - Explanation of Maiko - Lunch Box & Tea (pet bottle tea) - Pictures with frame - Special merchandise of Maiko Theater Ofuku Course (14:00-15:30, 16:00-17:30): - Matcha & Sweets served by the Maiko - Buyo Dance - Explanation of Maiko - Pictures with frame - Special merchandise of Maiko Theater Yakko Course (20:30-22:00, not available on Sunday): - Buyo Dance - Explanation of Maiko - Finger foods and snacks - All-you-can-drink alcoholic drink (Shochu, Wine, Whisky, and Japanese sake). Beer and craft beer are available for extra fees - Pictures with frame - Special merchandise of Maiko Theater Reservation is difficult to make, so make sure you use our service to book this program with no hassles!
strTitle: Watch Japanese Traditional Maiko Dance in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Our bar with penguins is a dining bar near Ikebukuro Station's West Exit. There are 4 penguins (2 pair of penguins) now. The penguins live at a spacious space, and move freely in the pool there. If the timing's right you will be able to feed the penguins at one or two times during the business hours. When you feed the penguins, feel free to take pictures. We will be happy if you upload your photo onto your SNS. *No flash photography, because the penguins are afraid of it. We offer so many kinds of foods and drinks. The "Penguin course" introduced this time is the most popular set menu in this bar, and this menu has five meals. It is very filling, and it will be able to give you satisfaction. Also, the All-you-can-drink is limited to 2 hours. You can choose the drinks that you like from the All-you-can-drink menu. *However, take one for each person at a time. All of the staff and the penguins are really looking forward to you seeing you! If you have any food allergies, please tell us when you make a reservation. Also, this food menu is one example among many. It is subject to change depending on the season or ingredients. When you come to our bar, we will show you to your seat. First, please choose one drink for each person from the All-you-can-drink menu. We will serve meals to your table in order after the toast. Seats are just 2-hour limited system. You can choose drinks that you like from the All-you-can-drink menu. (Take one for each person at a time) We offer five meals in the course. If you would like to eat more, please order separately. (it costs additional money) You can see the penguins closely during your time, and enjoy eating, drinking alcohol, talking. If the timing's right you will be able to feed to penguins. Right before the time limit expires, our staff will call out to you. But If you would like to extend your time, please tell us. Please contact us if you have many questions. We can speak simple English.
strTitle: See Penguins in a bar at Ikebukuro, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Yakiniku with bamboo has a lot of merit for foreigners as we explained above. No smoke. Our Japanese restaurant in Ikebukuro, Tokyo, is very compact. Usually Yakiniku restaurants are always filled with smoke from the grilled meat. But using bamboo removes almost all of the smoke. No smell. Japanese yakiniku uses fatty meat. When grilling it, it produces a greasy smell. It make your clothes retain the odor. But the bamboo absorbs the smell before it rises up from the grill. No burning. Dinner with friends is a very happy time. Talking with your friend makes you forget about the time. When you have a happy time, you might burn out the grilled meat if you don't notice it. But the bamboo protects the meat from burning out or getting charred. Please try the new yakiniku method that is being used for the first time in Japan at our restaurant!
strTitle: Try Yakiniku grilled on a bamboo at Yakiniku Zen, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Meeting at Kawaguchiko Station at 10:45 am, your pickup car will leave the station at 11:00 am. You will drive to Fujiten Snow Resort via Hot Spring, Yurari. On the way your guide will tell you about Mt. Fuji. Is this the first time for you to see the snow? The white snow is cold but so beautiful! Take a lot of pictures with snow! Easy activities such as sled or snowscoot are fun. If you are interested in skiing and snowboarding, there are seven slopes. Rental equipment for ski, snowboard, sled, snowscoot, and wear are available, so you can only bring yourself. (Please note that rental fees are not included in the tour price.) Your car will leave Fujiten Snow Resort at 14:00 pm. After experiencing the snow, you will drive to the hot spring, Yurari. Let's make you warm by bathing in a hot spring. Stretch your legs and arms in the large bathtub and feel relaxed. You can take a pick which restaurant is good for you, at snow resort or hot spring. Both restaurants have nice views of Mt. Fuji. Your car will leave the hot spring, Yurari at 17:32 pm and will arrive at Kawaguchiko Station around 18:00 pm.
strTitle: Mt. Fuji Ski Resort & Hot Spring Tour

strIntroduction: The initial meeting place is the in front of Shimokitazawa Station, Odakyu line or Keio-Inokashira Line. It is an exciting to place to hang out, but after a short greeting, I am taking you to one of the best grocery stores in town, Oozeki. It is an only-local food market and you will explore lots of everyday food consumed by Japanese people. We will shop our class ingredients here and I will answer all your questions about what you will see inside. After shopping, we will move to my cooking studio, taking a cab for less than 10 minutes. I will serving you welcome drink and we'll start cooking! We will cook a complete set of menu, including main dish, rice, miso-soup, small salad, or appetizer and dessert. I will introduce good quality seasonings of Japanese cooking and let you know how to distinguish them, which is a useful info for when you go back to your country. strIntroduction: There are a lot of important cultural properties in Tokyo. Visit one of them with with local people on this tour. What is an Important Cultural Property? An Important Cultural Property is a designation assigned to property by the Japanese Government(The Minister of Education, Science and Culture) in accordance with the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties. These structures, located in Japan, have particular significance academically and in terms of cultural history. The designation may also be assigned to tangible cultural properties among which are works of art or handicrafts. Reminder for visitors (rules in general applying to most properties): • Please take care not to soil or damage the building, exhibits, or plants. • Shoes must be taken off before entering the building. Also, the use of slippers is prohibited in the interest of preserving the facility. • Some rooms are off-limits due to requirements related to the preservation of the facility. Taking photographs and videos for commercial purposes are restricted and require separate procedures. • Open flames, food, and beverages are prohibited within the facility. • The house, being an Important Cultural Property, is not barrier free. Please be aware that assistance will be needed if visiting in a wheelchair. • Visitors are not permitted to bring animals inside the building or garden. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Visit Important Cultural Properties in Tokyo with locals

strIntroduction: Have you ever visited a palace in Japan? Akasaka Palace is not only visited by the emperor of Japan but also used to hold conferences like G7 Summits. Distinguished guests include famous leaders as Barack Obama, Aung San Suu Kyi, Margaret Thatcher and many more. We invite you to join us for a trip to the palace of its kind in Japan. The palace is open to the general public only for a short time, so join us for a visit while we can. About Akasaka Palace: Akasaka Palace or the State Guest House (Geihinkan in Japanese), is one of the two State Guesthouses of the Government of Japan. The palace was originally built as the Imperial Palace for the Crown Prince in 1909. Today the palace is designated by the government of Japan as an official accommodation for visiting state dignitaries. In 2009 the palace was designated as a National Treasure of Japan. The other state guest house is in Kyoto. Meeting time and Place: We will meet in front of Exit 1 (known as Akasaka entrance) of Yotsuya Station. It is covered by both JR and subway Metro Lines. Please don’t be late. We'll walk towards the palace. What to expect? A wow factor. We are sure you will definitely like this beautiful palace! Notes 1. Please refrain from taking photos. It is strictly prohibited inside. However, it is ok to take photos from outside the palace. 2. Audio guides are available in English and Japanese for an additional 200 JPY. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Visit Akasaka Palace in Tokyo with local people

strIntroduction: The winter night illuminations of UNESCO World Heritage Site Shirakawago village are one of the most anticipated seasonal events in Gifu prefecture, Japan. The amazing illuminations are only on for a few days per year, so don't miss out! In this comfortable and convenient bus tour departing from Nagoya you can see the lit up village and stroll the old streets of the traditional city Takayama. In addition, you will relish the taste of high-grade Hida beef! Brief information about the destinations: - Shirakawago: This is a World Heritage "gassho-zukuri" farmhouse village. Hundreds and thousands of tourists come to visit the village for its unique scenery, especially in the winter when snow covers the village and gives it a magical quality that is further enhanced by the winter illuminations lighting up the Ogamachi area. - Hida Takayama: This is an old post-station town from the Edo period, popularly called a "Little Kyoto″. Its quaint streets lined with old houses attract numerous tourists from home and abroad. Itinerary: - 9:00 am: Meet and depart from Nagoya Station - Eat a delicious grilled Hida beef lunch at Takayama. Hide beef is of the very highest grade, rivalling Kobe beef this is certainly a local delicacy! (50 min) - Take a scenic walk around Takayama old town and feel the history of this untouched corner of Japan (90 min) - Go to the Shirakawago Shiroyama Observatory Deck for an unparalleled view of the winter illuminations (150 min) - 22:20 pm: Return to Nagoya Station, end of tour. ※ The amount of snow is variable, depending on weather conditions. ※ If there are delays to the tour schedule our first priority will be the Shirakawago illuminations. In such case, strolling in Takayama may be omitted or shortened. ※ In Shirakawago, there is no shuttle bus service to the observatory during the illuminations. When you go, it takes around 30~40 minutes from the parking lot by walking. The road to the observatory might be closed owing to heavy snow or other weather conditions. This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Last Chance Hida-Takayama & Shirakawago Winter Illuminations

strIntroduction: You can experience Natural Skin Care – Cosmetic Electro-Acupuncture in Osaka, Japan! What does the treatment involve? 1. Before you start, you will be asked to fill in some details about how you are feeling and what you would like to improve with your facial firmness and tone. 2. Takes a before-and-after photo, so you can see the improvement after the cosmetic acupuncture. 3. Ultra-fine acupuncture pins are then inserted into the face and are left in for 20-30 minutes. Don't worry. You will immediately feel relaxed. It is actually important to relax and not to move too much, to get the full effect of the acupuncture and let your facial muscles tone up naturally 4. The acupuncture pins are then removed. ******************************************************** What's Electro-Acupuncture? As with traditional acupuncture, needles are inserted on specific points along the body. The needles are then attached to a device that generates continuous electric pulses using small clips. These devices are used to adjust the frequency and intensity of the impulse being delivered, depending on the condition being treated. Electro-acupuncture uses two needles at time so that the impulses can pass from one needle to the other. Several pairs of needles can be stimulated simultaneously, usually for no more than 30 minutes at a time. One advantage of electro-acupuncture is that a practitioner does not have to be as precise with the insertion of needles. This is because the current delivered through the needle stimulates a larger area than the needle itself. How Does it Work? •Fine lines may be erased, deeper ones reduced •Bags around the neck and eyes are firmed •Patients may experience firming of the jowls, reduction of under-eye bags •Skin will look softer/tauter and have a healthy glow •Sagging and sunken tendencies, such as droopy eyelids, crepey neck, jowls and double chin can be reduced •Acne, scarring, rosacea and discolouration is visibly reduced •Overall health and well-being is enhanced Cosmetic acupuncture is a safe and effective skin care solution for the prevention and treatment of the customary signs of ageing for most people. There are however some conditions where it should not be performed. These include: •Severe high blood pressure (it is okay when blood pressure is under control) •Severe migraines (this doesn’t mean headaches – acupuncture facial renewal can actually improve the symptoms of headache). If the patient is having a migraine only once every three months or so they can receive acupuncture facial renewal. •Pregnancy Cosmetic acupuncture should also not be performed during an acute infection, or an acute facial herpes breakout. The patient may wish to treat acute infections with general acupuncture until symptoms subside. Once these conditions have passed, the patient may receive a cosmetic acupuncture treatment. Does it hurt? You may experience a slight sensation where the needle is inserted, or a dull tingling or ‘lifting sensation’ that may radiate. This is a positive sign and means that the treatment is working. It is certainly less painful than you might think. Plucking your eyebrows would cause more eye-watering pain than acupuncture needles. Unlike the injection of potentially harmful chemicals into your skin, acupuncture facial renewal’s only side effect is an improved sense of health and well-being.
strTitle: Japanese Natural Facelift: Cosmetic Electro-Acupuncture

strIntroduction: This is a private guided day trip to Yoshinogari area in Saga, Kyushu! You can enjoy cycling between Yoshinogari railway station and Yoshinogari Historical Park. If you prefer a fifteen minute's walk, then let's walk! The Yoshinogari Historical Park is an outstanding archaeological site in Saga Prefecture. The huge park covers a large settlement from the Yayoi Period (400 BC to 300 AD).This archaeological site is of great importance in Japanese and world prehistory because the massive size and important nature of the settlement and the artifacts are found there. Yoshinogari consists of a settlement, a cemetery, and variously shaped territories. Bronze mirrors from China, Japanese-style bronze mirrors, bronze daggers, coins, bells, and halberds, iron tools, wooden tools, prehistoric human hair, and many other precious artifacts have been dug out from Yoshinogari features. The total area of this site is approximately 40 hectares. Many agencies have been exploring this site since 1986. Due to the superior features, artifacts, and significance in Japanese prehistory, the site was designated as a "Special National Historic Site" in 1991, and a National Park was created there in 1992. Ancient structures are being reconstructed on the site and the park is a major tourist attraction. You can apply for the following interactive workshops there. Magatama: You can make an ancient stone pendant. The material cost is 200-250 JPY. Last class is 1 hour and 30 min prior to the park's closing. Hi-Okoshi : You can make fire like the way ancient human did. The cost is 100 JPY. Last class is 1 hour prior to the park's closing. Tsuchi-bue : You can make an earthen flute. The cost is 100 JPY. Last class is 1 hour and 30 min prior to the park's closing. You can drop in at the site of Metabaru Airport's gate. It was one of the bases of kamikaze squad in WW2. A lot of young pilots departed from the airport, and most of them never returned. The story was turned into a movie in 1993. The title of the movie is "Summer of moonlight (月光の夏)". There are many good restaurants in and around the park. At your request, I can select the most adequate restaurant.
strTitle: Visit Yoshinogari in Saga, a time-travel to Japan's roots!

strIntroduction: Please come to our hostel, Guest House KURA. It's located in Suzaka city, Nagano. From Nagano Station, you can take a local train called "Nagano Dentetsu Line" to Suzaka Station. It's 15 mins walk from Suzaka station to our hostel. Our hostel is traditional Japanese old house, and was renovated in a way that retained the building's Japanese quint atmosphere. It's already more than 110 years old. We hope you can enjoy the traditional Japanese style atmosphere. According to your travel schedule, we will take you to the highly recommended outdoor onsen! It takes about 40 mins by car. This onsen is one of our favorite places known for its sulfuric water. This onsen also haa a private pool, so if you like you can enjoy it as a couple or family. Even if you have tattoo, they don't care about that in the private onsen!
strTitle: Try a natural onsen with snow view & stay overnight, Nagano

strIntroduction: This class is an attempt to get non-meditators aware of the benefits of meditating no matter what they believe. Meditation is not associated with any religion or philosophy but a part of the condition of life itself. In Japan the Shingon Buddhists of ancient times brought esoteric meditation from China and knew that this meditation was a science of expanding the mind into the reality of existence. Japan has a long history of this experience but it is shrouded in mysticism and hidden from the general public. Ancient meditation techniques traveled from India to China and later to Japan over a thousand years ago. It is part of not only ancient Japanese heritage but the world’s heritage. Let’s not lose it.
strTitle: Experience Esoteric Meditation in a local house in Kyoto

strIntroduction: You can rent and be dressed in a traditional Japanese costume, kimono or yukata (during the summer). You will be provided a memorable experience of the Japanese traditional culture. Our shop is located in the Gion district in Kyoto which is famous for being the geisha district. It is very centrally located and easy to find for someone not from the area. Wearing a kimono, you can visit the Yasaka Shrine or the Chionin Temple in about 2 minutes, the Kiyomizu-dera and the Heianjingu Shrine in about 15 minutes from the kimono shop on foot. You can visit Fushimi Inari Taisha, Arashiyama district and other various famous places in about 30 minutes by using train. strIntroduction: - - - - Tour Overview - - - - Tsukiji Market is a brilliant place for exploration, whether you’re a foodie, a people-watcher, a photographer, or all of the above. After 1-hour walking, move on to the Japan's largest Cooking school where you will enjoy Sushi Roll Making. - - - - What to Expect - - - - *Tsukiji Market* You will visit ONLY the Outer Market. Stop at a shrine to learn some tips about how to pray in Japanese traditional way instead of seafood wholesale area. Explore the local market with local friendly tour guide to experience some sample taste, while stop by some traditional shop selling such as kitchen tools, Japanese traditional knife, local pickles and more! If time permits, stop at Namiyoke Shrine to learn local tips about how to pray your wish in Japanese traditional way. *Sushi Roll Making Class* After spending around an hour in the Tsukiji Market, move on to a fully appointed gourmet cooking studio run by the largest cooking school in Asia. Learn how to prepare some of the most authentic washoku dishes, meaning traditional and homemade Japanese meals, including Sushi Rolls and Tamagoyaki (Japanese egg omelet) along with some side dishes. Learn various Japanese cooking techniques from your professional instructor and experience the essence of authentic Japanese flavor and spirit. Finish your tour by digging in to your culinary creations, accompanied by your choice of drinks. From the cooking school, make your own way back to your accommodations or next destination. - - - Tour Schedule - - - - 11:50 Meet up at Tsukiji Honganji Temple 12:00 Group walk at the Tsukiji Market (ONLY outer market) 13:30 Cooking class starts 15:00 Tour ends - - - Cooking Menu - - - Rolled-Sushi, Japanese egg omelet + one more dish with Japanese soup.
strTitle: Afternoon Tsukiji Gourmet Walking & Sushi Roll Making

strIntroduction: - - - Tour Overview - - - - Meet up with your guide at Tsukiji Honganji Temple, just outside the market’s main gate. As you navigate your way through this labyrinth of all local things, learn from your guide about the market’s history and why many Japan’s top chefs visit here daily to pick up the freshest-quality ingredients. You never know what you might find as you stroll past the stalls of this amazing food center. Stop by some local shops selling traditional knife, kitchen tools such as Bento box and other local things. If time permits, stop at a small shrine to learn about how to pray in traditional Japanese way with many tips that locals are following as always. **NOT visiting the Inner Seafood Wholesale Market** After exploring Tsukiji, you will then have a unique hands-on Tempura making experience. - - - Tour Schedule - - - - 11:50 Meet up 12:00 Tour Start 13:30 Cooking Class Starts 15:00 Tour ends - - - Note - - - - Depending on the day of travel, the sushi workshop takes place either in Ginza, Marunouchi or Nihionbashi.
strTitle: 3-Hour Tsukiji Gourmet Walking & Tempura Frying Experience

strIntroduction: Enjoy a Nabe (Hot Pot Dish) Party with local people in Tokyo! Hot Pot Cuisine is a conglomerate of ingredients cooked together in a hot pot, or “nabe” (nah-bay). Generally a number of people will eat together from a single pot. A wide range of ingredients can be used in hot pot cuisine, with one main ingredient usually boiled together with vegetables and tofu. The ingredients are cut into bite-sized pieces for an enjoyable meal. Except for special cases, an earthen pot is almost always used for hot pot cuisine. A portable burner is placed on the table for the pot to sit on, and the food is generally boiled on the spot while everyone eats, periodically adding new ingredients. Hot pot cuisine is most often consumed in the winter months to keep warm. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Enjoy a Nabe (Hot Pot Dish) Party with local people in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Enjoy Tokyo's Christmas markets with local people! Christmas market in Hibiya Park Among all the German-style Christmas markets happening in Tokyo in December, this Hibiya Park extravaganza just might be the one most worth attending: in addition to the obligatory stalls hawking everything from handmade holiday decorations to hot chocolate, German beer and glühwein, you can look forward to a 14m 'Christmas pyramid' imported straight from the city of Dresden. This tuned-up version of a traditional German holiday staple is apparently the largest of its kind in the world, and even has a Guinness World Record certificate to prove it. Christmas market in Roppongi Hills You will feel like you are in Germany at our Christmas Market, where gorgeously decorated shops and stalls will offer authentic German food and Christmas goods, with over a 1,000 items for sale. Come enjoy the warm atmosphere of a German Christmas! Yebisu Garden Place Christmas Marche Taking over from the farmer's markets that happen year round at Ebisu Garden Place's Clock Plaza, this European-style Christmas market offers all the usual knickknacks and goodies, from snow globes to mulled wine and continental grub, in addition to French specialities such as organic edibles from the island of Corsica and handmade candles. An impressive tree is set up right next to the stalls, while the shopping complex below is decorated with a massive Baccarat chandelier and thousands of shining LEDs. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Enjoy Christmas markets in Tokyo with local people

strIntroduction: This is a Thanksgiving Day Party with local people in Tokyo. Thanksgiving Day is a national holiday celebrated in Canada and the United States. It was originally celebrated as a day of giving thanks for the blessing of the harvest and of the preceding year. Thanksgiving is celebrated on the second Monday of October in Canada and on the fourth Thursday of November in the United States. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately to a bar of your choice. I can certainly introduce you to the hottest nightlife places in Tokyo!
strTitle: Thanksgiving Day Party with local people in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a "Movember" party in Tokyo with local people with a fake or real moustache. What makes a fun and interactive? Perfect timing and venue, interesting people, appealing choice of delicious drinks. What I would recommend is to come earlier and not to miss a chance to talk as much as you can. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately to a bar of your choice. I can certainly introduce you to the hottest nightlife places in Tokyo! About Movember: Movember is a charity event for men's health on a global scale, attempting to prevent men from dying too young. The combination of "Mo" comes from Moustache and November. There is a rule that men have to shave smoothly and after that can't shave until November 30th. They can keep only a Moustache, not a beard. It started in Adelaide in Australia, and spread to Oceania, Europe and North America. It became one of the most popular charity events.
strTitle: Enjoy a "Movember" Party in November with a (fake) moustache

strIntroduction: Let's enjoy Japanese Halloween costume play party together in Tokyo! Although Halloween wasn't celebrated in Japan until recent years, it's becoming popular year after year. Many stores sell colorful Halloween decorations, costumes, and sweets. Also, many Japanese cities/towns, shopping malls, and theme parks hold fun Halloween events in September and October. Halloween parades, costume parties, and trick-or-treat events are often observed in fall. Kosupure (cosplay) has been popular among Japanese youth. It's a Japanese word for costume play. Costume play in Japan usually means masquerade. People dress in anime/movie/computer game character costumes, uniforms, samurai/ninja costumes, kimono, and more. Lots of people enjoy wearing various costumes and make-ups/masks and becoming to their favorite characters. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately to a bar of your choice. I can certainly introduce you to the hottest nightlife places in Tokyo!
strTitle: Party during the Halloween Costume Night in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Let’s enjoy the annual autumn night light-up in a famous Japanese Garden in Tokyo with local people! Rikugien's annual light-up returns again for when the park's trees turn red and golden in the autumn night. The view reflects beautifully off the water, creating a magical and unforgettable atmosphere. The park stays open until 9 pm for the duration of the event, the cosy teahouses are open throughout, and you can catch guided tours of the park at 11 am and 2 pm daily. The light-up takes place at the end of November and the beginning of December. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: See the Autumn night light-up in a Japanese Garden in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Experience Bonenkai (forget-the-year gathering), Japanese style end-of-year party at a Japanese style Izakaya A bounenkai (literally "forget-the-year gathering") is a Japanese drinking party that takes place at the end of the year, and is generally held among groups of co-workers or friends. The purpose of the party, as its name implies, is to forget the woes and troubles of the past year, and hopefully look to the new year, usually by consumption of large amounts of alcohol. A bounenkai does not take place on any specific day, but they are usually held in December. An izakaya (Japanese: [izakaja], ee-ZAH-ka-yah) is a type of informal Japanese gastropub. They are casual places for after-work drinking. They have been compared to Irish pubs and early American saloons and taverns. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately to a bar of your choice. I can certainly introduce you to the hottest nightlife places in Tokyo!
strTitle: Join an End of Year party (Bounenkai) in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Enjoy a wonderful journey in Hokkaido by participating in this 2 days private guided tour, to visit Otaru, Muroran City, and Sapporo City! This tour comes along with private transportation service with English-speaking supports, giving you a full privacy while traveling around Hokkaido! The journey starts at New Chitose Airport on the first day, where you will depart for Shiraoi town to have your lunch there. Enjoy a wonderful Wagyu lunch at Shiraoi town before heading to Muroran City! After lunch, you will visit Muroran City for sightseeing, where you will visit the Cape Earth, Sokuryozan Observatory Tower, and Mitara Muroran. Enjoy the great view of the Pacific Ocean from over 100 m altitude! Also visit Sokuryozan Observatory Deck, where you can enjoy the view of Muroran City! Also visit Mitara Muroran, a rest area in Muroran City, where you can see the beautiful Hakucho (Swan) Bridge! You will visit Lake Toya Onsen, an onsen area in Hokkaido, which is famous for its hot spring baths and beautiful view of the lake. You will spend the night at one of the hotels in Lake Toya Onsen! On the second day, you will visit Makkari to stop by Wakimizunosato, where you can buy delicious tofu products, and you can enjoy the view of Mt. Yotei from the car windows as well! After arriving in Otaru Canal, you will walk around the canal for an hour to explore the beauty of the canal and the city! Stop by the museums, shops, and restaurants to get the beautiful souvenirs for your family back home! Before leaving for Sapporo, you will have a sushi lunch at one of the restaurants in Otaru, where you can enjoy exquisite sushi served by the freshest seafood products from Japan Sea! At the end of the tour, you will be visiting Sapporo to see its beautiful tower clock and to explore the old Hokkaido Government Office (Akarenga Government Office)! The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 - Depart from New Chitose Airport 11:00 - Have lunch in Shiraoi area (e.g.: Farm Restaurant Uemura) 12:00-13:00 - Muroran City sightseeing: Cape Earth, Sokuryozan Observatory Deck, and Mitara Muroran 14:00-16:00 - Visit Lake Toya Onsen and spend the night at the hotels in that area 17:00 Day 2 - Depart from the hotel 9:00 - Visit Makkari and stop by Wakimizunosato to buy tofu products 9:40-10:10 - Enjoy the breathtaking view of Mt. Yotei from the car windows - Walk around the Otaru Canal 11:40-12:40 - Have sushi lunch in Otaru (e.g.: Otaru Masazushi) 13:00-14:00 - Sapporo City sightseeing: Sapporo Clock Tower, Old Hokkaido Government Office (Akarenga Government Office) 15:00-16:00 - Tour ends at Sapporo Station or hotels around the main street 16:15 Reservation for this tour is difficult to make, so we recommend you to book this tour with no hassles by using our wonderful service!
strTitle: 2 Days Private Guided Tour in Muroran, Otaru, & Sapporo!

strIntroduction: Have you ever wished a plan for girls—shopping, eating and visiting some cultural places? This is a plan made especially for women who would love to have a tour and gain cultural experiences just like the local girls do in Japan. Please consult with us if you have any specific foods, shopping districts or places you would like to visit. This tour includes many cultural places to visit, as well as local areas where people in Osaka shop. There are two different options, so please pick the ones you would like to visit depending on your interest. Here is a brief information of the places you will be visiting. ・Tsuyuno-shrine: This shrine is known for the god of love and relationship. Many woman visit here to wish for ever-lasting love, to grant their one-sided love, and to wish for new love. ・Hep five and Hankyu department store: Both of them are two famous shopping department stores in Osaka. The size of these department stores are enormous, and you will find anything from clothes, foods and souvenirs! ・Dotonbori: Dotonbori is a very famous shopping district in Osaka. Here, you will find numerous restaurants, shops and cultural cites. Dotonbori street is very popular for people to eat and walk. It will be very bright and loud at night, and you will see why people like spending their time in the city during the night in Japan. -Scheduled Plan (Model Course. You can request places to go if you have)- 9:30am Meet at Osaka station 9:40am~10:30am Visit Tsuyuno-shrine (Famous for the god of love and relationship) 10:40am〜1:00pm Shopping at Hep Five + Hankyu Department Store Osaka Umeda Main Store 1:20pm~2:40pm Walk around Dotonbori -Plan A 3:20pm~6:20pm Visit Osaka Aquarium KAIYUKAN 7:10pm Visit to Takoyaki Museum in Universal CityWalk Osaka End of the tour -Plan B 3:10pm~5:00pm Visit to Sumiyoshi Grand Shrine 5:50pm~Umeda Sky Building End of the tour Come eat delicious food in Osaka, shop clothes that are in the trend right now, and visit the temple to wish success in your love life! Enjoy your time with your girl friends and make this trip an unforgettable one!
strTitle: Eat, Play, and Shop! 1 Day Private Osaka Trip for Girls

strIntroduction: We want to make sure your family have the best day in Kyoto it could possibly be. strIntroduction: The traditional Japanese house is just a 1-minute walk from Kinkakuji Temple (Golden Pavilion). In the same building, you can experience tea ceremony as well. The Ikebana class is also held by a master who has qualification in English. First, the master will explain the history of Ikebana, and the differences between Japanese and western flower arrangement. For the next step, the instructor will show you the traditional style (rule) of Ikebana, how to cut, bend, and make angles. Finally, you will try making your original Ikebana!
strTitle: Enjoy Ikebana (Japanese flower arrangement) in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: The famous Beaujolais Nouveau wine went on sale on the third Thursday in November. Venue (changes depend on the events): -Tableaus Lounge (Jazz and Cigar bar) -Cavo (small local french wine bar) -Any ohter popular local bars (in Ebisu, Daikanyama, Omotesando, Roppongi, Shibuya, etc.) This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately to a bar of your choice.
