strIntroduction: Tuesday Night Gion Night walk 7 pm Discover the area of Gion at the best time of day when the lanterns light up in the evening. See the historic neighbourhoods and geisha districts and make a special night visit to some temples and shrines. After that enjoy a beverage in a local pub and learn about the nightlife customs new and old. Wednesday Group Bike Tour 10 am Discover Kyoto on two wheels, by far the nicest way to get around the city. We discover three major sites of beauty as well as discover some of the back streets and unique neighbourhoods. We offer background knowledge and stories to help you get more out of your visit. Thursday Bar Hopping Night 8 pm On this fun night out we visit three or more local bars including some hidden away spots and depending on the mood sometimes head to a club, karaoke bar or end up sipping hot sake in a Japanese izakaya. You can enjoy sharing stories about travel in Japan with your new drinking buddies or even meet some locals along the way. Friday Hike and Hot Springs 11 am Enjoy a fantastic day in a little gem of an area just north of Kyoto city. This hike to the top of the modestly tall Kurama mountain is a nice work out and there is so much to see along the way. It’s great for getting to see the lush Japanese countryside without having to venture too far. After the hike enjoy a delicious lunch followed by a rejuvenating hot springs bath. A perfect end to the day.
strTitle: Enjoy four fun days of various activities in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is the ultimate Stand Up Paddle (SUP) boarding adventure in the tropical waters of Okinawa! Here is the itinerary: - Gather at our handmade marine house in Onna village, Okinawa - We will move down to the beach and teach you the basics of how to SUP. - You will start by paddling with your knees on the board. - Once you are familiar with it, we will then try and stand on the board. - The more confident you become, the more enjoyable it will be. - Depending on the condition of the sea, we can discover the surroundings or even enjoy surfing! This tour departs at 8:30, 10:30, 13:30, and 15:00 daily. Please state your preferred time when you make your booking, and if you require pickup at your hotel in the Onna village area. If you're staying outside Onna village, please come to the meeting point by bus or taxi. ※This tour is for 13 years old and above Let's have fun and enjoy SUP together in Okinawa! We look forward to hearing from you!
strTitle: Try a Stand Up Paddle adventure in Okinawa!

strIntroduction: What is takoyaki? Takoyaki is a fried octopus ball, which is a “must eat" food when you visit Osaka. In this activity you'll learn how to make takoyaki at a takoyaki stand. At this workshop you will not only eat takoyaki, but also get the chance to make them by yourself and feel like working at a takoyaki stand. Isn't that fun? Here is the detailed program of the activity: 1. You'll learn how to make takoyaki, which is the most exciting part of the workshop! The most important thing is how to make a beautiful round-shaped takoyaki. 2. You can choose some of the takoyaki flavors of the shop. 3. You can taste the takoyaki you make. This activity is available under the following schedule: Everyday : 15:00 - 20:00 pm (a total of 2 hours during this time period) How about tasting takoyaki you make for yourself? It'll be one of the best memories of your Osaka trip!
strTitle: Make Takoyaki at a Takoyaki stand in Osaka!

strIntroduction: The Tokyo Pub Crawl is basically a "bar hopping" tour. Your local tour operator will organize a group of people: some friends and some complete strangers. Many people come from overseas, as well as Japan. Everyone is welcome, lots of people come alone, don't be shy. By the end of the night its just one happy family. The average group size is 80 - 100 people, so things will be pretty lively! Together, we will visit various bars or clubs over the course of an evening in Tokyo. In a nutshell, the Tokyo Pub Crawl is a great way to experience some fun venues that the city's nightlife has to offer, and meet fun and interesting people along the way. Bar 1 Usually a laid-back, local dive bar with some space to sit down. Good environment for talking and getting to know each other. We will be doing a mixer/icebreaker here, so get ready to mingle! First shot will be handed out and done as a group. For those who are really thirsty, you'll have a chance to win a free drink right away. Note: Food will not be served, so make sure to grab a bite beforehand! There's many restaurants in the area. Bar 2 Things will heat up a bit at the second bar, and after a drink or 2, why not? More music and plenty of chances to get to know your fellow pub crawlers even more, as we kick-off our games and activities. By games and activities, we mean more chances to win free drinks. Hint: Hangout near the DJ booth for a head start on free drink contests. Bar 3 At this point, if you've elected to consume alcohol, you'll be drunk. Either way, you'll have met some cool people. Finding a table to sit down and chat shouldn't be a problem, but you'll probably be dancing instead. The games and contests continue here, so best to follow the crowd if you're looking to get in on the action. Getting in the action means free drinks. Are you sensing the theme here? Bar 4 / The Club If you haven't found yourself on the dance floor by now, you'll be hard pressed not to do so at our last stop, which is always a nightclub. PRO TIP: Stay ALL NIGHT! The club will be open until 5 am. The locals start arriving around 1:00 am or so. So of things look a little empty, convince the person next to you to hang out a bit and give it a shot. Nothing left to do than party the night away. NOTE: The Tokyo pub crawl officially ends at 11:30 pm, so make sure to keep tabs on your last train. Although if there is an after party, and there often is, you're invited! If you have any questions about train schedules, ask the pub crawl staff.
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo's Night Life with a Tokyo Pub Crawl

strIntroduction: This is a private tour tailored for you, not a group tour. Encounter impressive and beautiful temples, shrines, castle from as early as the 8th century in Kyoto. About 20% of the national treasures are located there. There are 17 temples and shrines registered as World Heritage Sites by UNESCO. Leave the guide to make plans or if you had any requests for places to visit, tell me. Usually two or three sites are available as a one day trip. Especially in the case of big temples or shrines, two places are enough for the available time. Example tour: Meet at Tokyo Station at 9 am Go to Kyoto by bullet train (Shinkansen) Visit by local train one of the world heritage temples, famous for its beautiful Japanese garden. Enjoy natural views including Arashiyama mountain and the bamboo forest by riding a Jinrikisha. Have lunch at local restaurant at 1 pm. Go to another famous temple by train, walking or taxi. Encounter the marvelous Buddhist art culture, or go to Nijo Castle which dates from the 16th century. Take a break with green tea and sweets. Buy box meal for supper on the Shinkansen. Arrive back at Tokyo Station at 19-20:00 pm. Depending on the season, the recommendable temple or shrine are different. There are many tourists and Kyoto is very crowded in spring and autumn. It is not guaranteed how many places you can visit.
strTitle: Take a one day private trip from Tokyo to Kyoto with a guide

strIntroduction: It is already winter and there are many romantic winter illumination lights all around Tokyo: Shibuya, Roppongi, Nakameguro, Omotesando, and more. Do you have anything special planned for winter holidays? If no, please join this event and make international friends. Example of the itinerary: - meet at 20:00-20:15 - walk to see the illumination lights: 20:15-21:00 - visit a bar and make friends: 21:30-23:00 During the Christmas season, lets exchange gifts to each other. Please bring a small gift during that period. Note: the winter illuminations in Tokyo are on until January. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Go out on a winter illumination viewing and meet-up in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a unique 1-day tour in which you can immerse yourself in the world of traditional Kendo and samurai! The tour consists of the following experiences: 1) Kendo experience With over 20 years of Kendo experience, Keio University Kendo club graduate Japanese Kendo practitioner and Malaysian Kendo representatives will help you learn and experience authentic Kendo while great fun and safely. We will guide beginners thoroughly until they can have a taste of combat game or match. Have a taste of a real “battle” and bring forth the fighting. You will be tested and will have the chance to test what you have learn during the tour through “Balloon Kendo” with other participants in a mini-tournament format. 2) Special Samurai lunch After the Kendo experience, we'll take you to have lunch at a Kendo-themed restaurant. We provide a special samurai meal and Kendo/Samurai goods. You can enjoy the taste of Japanese traditional dishes and atmosphere. 3) Visiting a Kendo gear factory "Bogu", the armour suit used in KENDO, is a traditional craft that has been passed on for generations in Japan for over a century. A guide will first introduce you to the principles and ideals of the Samurai and Kendo which will be followed by a tour to the traditional armour workshop where the craft has been passed on in the family for many generations. Let's all experience the "Samurai Spirit" and feel "the heart of the craftsmen"! Model schedule, starting at 8:40 am: 8:40 am: Meeting at Uguisudani Station North exit 9:00 am-11:00 am: Kendo experience (at Uguisudani) 12:00 pm-13:00 pm: Lunch at a Kendo restaurant (at Ikebukuro) 14:00 pm-15:00 pm: Visiting Kendo gear factory (at Nishishinjuku gochome) Model schedule, starting at 9:40 am: 9:40 am: Meeting at Uguisudani Station North exit 10:00 am-12:00 pm: Kendo experience (at Uguisudani) 13:00 pm-14:00 pm: Lunch at a Kendo restaurant (at Ikebukuro) 15:00 pm-16:00 pm: Visiting Kendo gear factory (at Nishishinjuku gochome)
strTitle: Experience 1 day Kendo tour with Samurai lunch in Tokyo

strIntroduction: There are seven Japanese Sake breweries at Saijo, Hiroshima, within a kilometer distance south of JR Saijo Station, alongside the old western Japan road Sanyodo. Unlike the winery or brewery tours in other areas, a car is not necessary for this one. Two hours on foot is enough to visit all the breweries. You can enjoy tasting sake in each brewery as you wish, without worrying about transportation. A certified national guide as well as sake sommelier will help you appreciate not only sake but also Saijo, a town known for its historic streets and houses, as well as the food and sweets related to sake. Detailed information about the tour: 1) Available days: Every day except Mondays 2) Hours: any 2 hours between 10:00 and 16:00 3) Meeting Place: JR Saijo Station Note: There is a possibility that some breweries are closed at the time of the tour due to their business calendar, etc.
strTitle: Take a Japanese Sake brewery guided tour at Saijo, Hiroshima

strIntroduction: The splendid theater Yamanaka-za in Yamanaka Onsen, Ishikawa prefecture, is located in the same building as the women's bath of the public bath house Kikunoyu. Yamanaka Onsen is easily accessible from Kanazawa city and worth a visit not only for its beautiful nature and healing hot springs, but also because of its rich cultural heritage. Inside the theater you will see a gorgeous display of Yamanaka lacquerware with gold decoration, ancient scrolls, lattice doors, coffered ceilings and much more! The highlight however is the performance of traditional folklore songs and dances by the well-trained elegant local geisha artists. Every Saturday, Sunday and on public holidays from 15:30 a 1-hour performance is held in Yamanaka-za. Spectators can watch skilled geisha artists performing a total of 6 traditional songs, among which are the famous Yamanaka-bushi, the Shishi lion dance, and more. Only on Saturdays you can meet a geisha after the performance and visit the backstage together where she will teach you the steps of the traditional dances. At the end of this experience, the geisha will give you a Japanese sweet as a souvenir. Discover the geisha art of Yamanaka Onsen in the gorgeous theater hall Yamanaka-za!
strTitle: See a geisha performance of folklore songs in Yamanaka Onsen

strIntroduction: This 2-days Hiroshima and Kurashiki Tour starts at Kyoto Station and ends at Osaka. Visit famous tourist spots like Itsukushima Shrine, the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum, the Atomic Bomb Dome, the Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, the Ohara Museum of Art and Okayama Korakuen! On Day 1, you will visit the beautiful Itsukushima Shrine as well as historical places like the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum, and the Atomic Bomb Dome. You will learn about the history of Japan and visit UNESCO World Heritage Sites! On Day 2, you will stroll around Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter including the Ohara Museum of Art and a visit to Okayama Korakuen. You will feel the traditional Japanese atmosphere and relax in the beautiful landscapes. All of the spots in this tour are worth a visit, if you'd like to learn the history of Japan, feel the traditional Japanese culture, and relax in beautiful natural spaces, don't miss the opportunity to visit the best spots in Hiroshima & Kurashiki area! The tour starts in Kyoto with a ride on the Shinkansen and ends in Osaka. This tour is available on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays. The price includes: lunch on day 2, admission fee, transportation fee, English guide fee, accommodation fee, pick-up and drop-off service at designated hotels.
strTitle: Enjoy a 2-Days Hiroshima & Kurashiki Tour from Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This 2-days Hiroshima and Kurashiki Tour starts at Shin Osaka station and ends in Kyoto. Visit famous tourist spots like Itsukushima Shrine, the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum, the Atomic Bomb Dome, the Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, the Ohara Museum of Art and Okayama Korakuen! Your journey starts by riding the Shinkansen bullet train at Shin Osaka Station all the way to Hiroshima station. Then, take the ferry to the Miyajima and Itsukushima Shrine! Find your best spot for taking beautiful pictures of the famous floating shrine. In the afternoon you will visit Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park to learn about the history of japan at the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum and to see the Atomic Bomb Dome. On Day 2, stroll around Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, where you can see traditional Japanese buildings, then visit the Ohara Museum of Art and visit Okayama Korakuen, considered one of the top 3 gardens in Japan! You will finish your journey with a shinkansen ride to Kyoto. This tour is available on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays. The tour includes: lunch on day 2, admission fees, transportation fees, English-speaking guide fee, accommodation fee and pick-up and drop-off service at designated hotels.
strTitle: Enjoy a 2-Days Hiroshima & Kurashiki Tour from Osaka!

strIntroduction: This is a 1 day tour that will take you to Hiroshima and Miyajima by Shinkansen bullet train from Kyoto with an English-speaking guide! You will visit Itsukushima shrine in Miyajima, the Peace memorial Park, the Peace Memorial Museum and the atomic bomb dome in Hiroshima. Don't miss the chance to explore the top 3 popular tourist attractions in Hiroshima and Miyajima! Miyajima is an island where, as the legend goes, people and Gods live together. It is one of the top three scenic spots in Japan and it is well-known for the floating Itsukushima shrine and its great Torii gate. Itsukushima shrine is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and it has more than 1400 years of history. At the time when Taira-no-Kiyomori began the construction of this shrine in 1168, it was an attempt to build the mythical Ryugu-jo (Dragon Palace), where the goddess of the sea lives. Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park is one of the most famous memorial parks in Japan. The park houses several historical buildings and monuments including the Peace Memorial Museum, the atomic bomb dome, and the Memorial cenotaph for the atomic bomb victims. The Peace Memorial Museum opened in 1955, with the purpose of showing the damage caused by atomic bomb, and promote the eradication of nuclear weapons. These are all must-visit places for visitors who want to know the history of Japan! This tour is available everyday except for Tuesdays and Thursdays.
strTitle: Explore Hiroshima & Miyajima by Shinkansen from Kyoto!

strIntroduction: An ideal round-trip tour for first time travelers to Japan to visit the top sites and wonders of Japan before returning to Tokyo. Day 1 begins with a luxury coach trip to Mt. Fuji and its many scenic views, including the 5th Station panorama at 2,300 m above sea level! After a traditional Japanese lunch, you will take a cruise on Lake Ashi, then ride over the volcanic Hakone mountains on the Mt. Komagatake ropeway. Day 1 concludes with an exciting bullet train ride from Odawara Station to Kyoto and you will check in to your hotel. Day 2 begins with visiting the sights by tour bus, including: Nijo Castle, Kinkakuji Temple, Kyoto Imperial Palace, Heian Shrine, Sanjusangendo Hall, and Kiyomizu Temple. The day includes a stop for lunch, and concludes with a bullet train ride back to Tokyo. Pick up and drop off is at specified Tokyo and Kyoto hotels. *Tour prices depend on hotel's location. All prices include accommodation, lunch, English-speaking guide, admission fees and transportation costs. Please check when booking for any available special offers.
strTitle: Enjoy a 2-Day Tour at Mt. Fuji, Hakone and Kyoto from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: If you are interested in Japanese culture, this experience will give you a wonderful trip. Departing from Tokyo City, the bullet train will take you to Gifu prefecture. Then, after taking a local line, you can slip back in time to the Edo era! Hida Takayama is famous for it's beautifully preserved Edo-style streets, stunning scenery and traditional architectures. There, you can explore around the town for one of its many museums, its nature and delicious foods. Ramen noodles and Japanese beef are famous in Hida Takayama, and don't forget checking out the Hida Folk Village, in the Sanmachi area! After you explore the town, Takayama green hotel welcomes you to a room and hot spring. Please relax as much as you like. DAY1 10:30 - 12:40 -Departure from Tokyo/Shinagawa/Shin-Yokohama Station *Please check the tickets that will be delivered to you before the departure date for the exact time. -Head to Nagoya by Hikari Shinkansen (reserved seat) from Tokyo Station, Shinagawa Station, or Shin-Yokohama Station. -Head to Hida Takayama by Hida Limited Express (reserved seat) from Nagoya. 15:00 - 17:20 -Takayama Station -Check in at the Takayama Green Hotel, and then spend the afternoon and evening exploring the quaint mountain town! DAY2 Morning to early afternoon. Check out the hotel and enjoy free time in Hida Takayama. 15:30 - 16:50 Take the Hida Limited Express to Nagoya Station from Hida Takayama Station Please check your itinerary and tickets for the exact time. Take the Nozomi Shinkansen (reserved seat) from Nagoya Station to Tokyo Station. Check your tickets for the exact times. 20:00-21:20 The trip ends at Shin-Yokohama/Shinagawa/Tokyo Station
strTitle: Visit Hida Takayama, Gifu, by Shinkansen from Tokyo

strIntroduction: This plan is a one-day return-trip from Tokyo to Kyoto by the fastest Shinkansen, Nozomi. If you take this tour plan, you will speed to Kyoto by the Tokaido Shinkansen line and Nozomi Shinkansen which is famous as the fastest bullet train in Japan. With the Nozomi Shinkansen you can expect a comfortable trip to Kyoto on an incredibly precise service. During the train trip, you can enjoy a scenic view of Mt. Fuji and Biwa Lake which are an excellent representation of Japan's nature. Then discover historical buildings and associated historical places. You will also have the opportunity to try “Ekiben” which is a Japanese bento sold on a train or at a train station. Each station and train has their own special ekiben, based on the local cuisine lunch and it is one of the highlight of a riding Shinkansen. If you are interested in trying an ekiben, you can choose one from a wide range at Tokyo station. On the tour you will visit three of the most popular tourist attractions in Kyoto. Nijo Castle is a UNESCO registered building which was once the house for the shogun and his visitors. The Kinkakuji, which is Japan's famous Golden Temple which is covered in gold, and surrounded by a traditional Japanese pond. The last attraction is the Kyoto Imperial Palace which was once a residence of the Emperor of Japan. Schedule Details: 06:00 : Check in and departure time -Tokyo Shinagawa/ Yokohama Shin-Yokohama -Arrival Kyoto Station -Nijo Castle (50 min) -Kinkakuji Temple (40 min) -Kyoto Imperial Palace (40 min) 12:40-13:00 : Afternoon - Free Time 20:00 : Kyoto Train Station 22:30-23:20 : Tour ends upon reaching Tokyo, Shinagawa or Shin-Yokohama Station ※About Tickets※ - We cannot 100% guarantee tickets. After we confirm your booking, we will purchase them for you as soon as possible, but please be aware there's always a slight chance for them to sell out in the meantime. - In addition, you may not be able to receive a refund once we obtain tickets for you. - In the event we cannot acquire tickets, we will reimburse you the full cost. - Please reserve weekend tickets early because they sell out fast. ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We require at least 3 full business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if you do not provide us your hotel information at least 3 full business days prior your ticket date, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. - If your hotel reservation details change, please tell us immediately through the Voyagin dashboard. - We only deliver to hotels with a concierge with whom we can confirm the receipt of the ticket delivery. We do not deliver tickets to hostels, guesthouses, or private residences. Please let us know if you are not staying at a hotel so we can provide our office details for you to pickup the tickets. 2. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station. Address: (English) Miyamasu ON Building 5th floor, 1-15-8 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo (Japanese) 〒150-0002 東京都渋谷区渋谷 1-15-8 宮益 ON ビル 5F Detailed Directions (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/shibuya-station-to-voyagin-office Google Map (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/voyagin-google-map
strTitle: Sightsee on Kyoto Tour via Shinkansen from Tokyo to Kyoto

strIntroduction: Those travelers who visit Japan with the aim to learn more about the distinctive local culture and experience it, will certainly enjoy participating in an authentic tea ceremony. This activity is located next to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the Golden Pavilion (Kinkakuji) in Kyoto and gives you the chance not only to discover the secrets of Sado, the way of tea, with its rules and etiquette, but also to experience the tea ceremony as a hands-on activity, in which you will make the green tea yourself! You will learn more about the traditions of tea ceremony and its rules by a professional expert. You will witness the elegance and beauty of a genuine tea ceremony, before participating actively by making your own green tea and tasting it with delicious Japanese sweets! Don't miss this excellent opportunity to experience the way of tea in the traditional atmosphere of Kyoto!
strTitle: Learn how to make green tea in a tea ceremony in Kyoto

strIntroduction: One of the must-do things in Japan is trying on a beautifully ornamented kimono or yukata. This activity is located just next to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the Golden Pavilion (Kinkakuji) in Kyoto and gives you the chance to pick your favourite kimono or yukata from a large selection and put it on with the help of a professional instructor. The photo opportunities will be a valuable and wonderful memory from your visit to Kyoto! You might already know that yukata is a lighter version of kimono that people wear mainly in summer, but you will find it surprisingly difficult to tie the obi belt properly. A traditional kimono is even more complicated to put on. However, in this experience a professional instructor will help you put on the kimono or yukata in the most authentic way, so that the final result will be definitely picture-worth! Book this cultural experience and enjoy the elegant appearance of traditional Japan!
strTitle: Try a beautiful kimono next to Kyoto's Golden Pavilion!

strIntroduction: Those travelers who visit Japan with the aim to learn more about the distinctive local culture and experience it, will certainly enjoy participating in an authentic tea ceremony. This activity in the center of Osaka gives you the chance not only to discover the secrets of Sado, the way of tea, with its rules and etiquette, but also to experience the tea ceremony as a hands-on activity, in which you will make the green tea yourself! The real Japanese home that you will enter is located just next to Shitennoji Temple, one of the country's oldest Buddhist temple and the very first one to be built by the state. The spirit of ancient history in the middle of a large urban environment represents the epitome of Japan's attractive contrasting image. You will learn more about the traditions of tea ceremony and its rules by a professional expert. You will witness the elegance and beauty of a genuine tea ceremony, before participating actively by making your own green tea and tasting it with delicious Japanese sweets! Don't miss this excellent opportunity to experience the way of tea in the heart of Osaka!
strTitle: Participate in a tea ceremony in a real Japanese home, Osaka

strIntroduction: Every spring during the Cherry Blossom season Japanese people gather at parks under the cherry trees to appreciate the beauty of these fragile and quick-blooming flowers before they disappear. They bring some foods and drinks, as well as a blue sheet to sit on, then enjoy the picnic while appreciating the beauty of nature. Nagoya Castle is one of Japan's largest castles, and is the largest by the territory. On its grounds you can visit not only the castle itself, but also Honmaru Palace, which has been rebuilt in its original design fully made from wood and complete with wall art. Schedule: 10:00 AM: Meet at Nagoya Station Tourist Information Centre and go to Depachika Shopping centre to buy foods and drinks for the picnic. 10:45 AM: Take subway to Nagoya Castle 11:15 AM: Arrive at Nagoya castle. Leave the foods at lockers and enjoy free time exploring the castle and the grounds 1:00 PM: Arrive at Meijo Park for the picnic under the cherry blossoms. Such picnics are called "Hanami". 2:30 PM: End the tour at Sakae
strTitle: Enjoy Cherry Blossom Party and Nagoya Castle Tour

strIntroduction: Join this program and have a wonderful winter journey in Hokkaido! Enjoy fun snowmobiling program and fill your tummy with the BBQ lunch! This program can be joined by everyone as the instructor will teach you how to ride the snowmobile. You can also experience eating the delicacies of Hokkaido on a table made from snow! We recommend you to participate in this tour on the last day of your visit, as this program takes place at "10 pound", a recreation area located in between Sapporo City and New Chitose Airport! We also offer free hotel pick-up and drop-off service within Sapporo city area with taxi, so you can travel safely and efficiently with this program! Below is the sample itinerary for this tour: - 9:30 Free pick-up service at your hotel in Sapporo - 10:40 Arrive at "10 pound" - 11:00-12:00 Snowmobiling - 12:00-13:30 BBQ lunch - 14:30 Drop-off service at your hotel in Sapporo ※Important Notes※ - The minimum participants of this tour is 2 people - The heights of the participants must be over 120 cm - Children must be accompanied by an adult - Children in some cases cannot ride on the snowmobile alone, so the instructor will accompany them - The taxi driver is not an English-speaking tour guide - The guide / instructor will explain things in simple English - The program might be cancelled due to severe weather or course conditions etc. - Riding a snowmobile must be performed with caution, so please follow the guide’s instruction at all times - Rental snow wear is also available, please let us know about the size when making the reservation - Depending on the weather, the lunch might be served on a wood table as well. Reservation is difficult to make, so make sure that you book this program in advance with our service!
strTitle: Snowmobile & BBQ with Taxi Service in Sapporo, Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: Visit Hokkaido and explore the beauty of Lake Shikotsu with this clear Kayak tour program! Cruise along Lake Shikotsu with our glass bottom Kayaks, which only 20 of them are available in Japan so far! Enjoy the view of the crisp clear water of lake Shikotsu and discover Lake Shikotsu's great ecosystem and nature with this tour program! Lake Shikotsu offers incredible scenery through the year, both on land and underwater, and it is the only place in Japan where you can see the red salmon swimming. In the Winter, you can see Lake Shikotsu settling for a long winter. You can see the trees start to frozen and see the wild animals of Lake Shikotsu, which you can only see in the winter. Lake Shikotsu never freezes, even during the winter, and it is also known as the lake with clearest water during the winter in Japan! ※Important Notes※ - The participants must be older than 4 years old - Children must be accompanied by parents - Children whose heights are under 140 cm can only participate in the tour from July to September - Pregnant women cannot participate in this tour - The tour will still be conducted even when it rains or snows. We will only cancel the tour for safety reasons due to severe weathers - Discounted ticket for the natural hot springs Marukoma Onsen is available if you would like to go after the tour. - If you are participating in this tour during the winter, please let us know about your height, weight, and shoe size for the wet suits. Rental fee is included in the price Book this tour with no hassles by using our service, and get free CD-R of your photos taken at Lake Shikotsu!
strTitle: Clear Kayak Tour in Lake Shikotsu from Sapporo, Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: Have a wonderful winter journey in Hokkaido with your friends or family and visit Snowland Rurumappu, where you can enjoy playing in the snow! Snowland Rurumappu is a snow theme park located in Eniwa, Hokkaido, and it is famous for its high quality snow and environment for snow playing and tube sled! In addition to the snow activity, you can also enjoy banana boating at Rurumappu! Wear your snow shoes, and explore Rurumappu by walking in the snow, and take a break inside a kamakura snow dome while enjoying a cup of free hot drink as well! Free hotel pick-up and drop-off service within Sapporo city area is available. You can also enjoy a Genghis Khan BBQ lunch or Cheese Fondue lunch inside the Kamakura by purchasing the option menu! strIntroduction: Spend the weekend and the holidays by spoiling yourself to stay at one of Kyoto's best hotel, Hotel Monterey Kyoto! Explore the local culture and the history of Kyoto by visiting many historical places and famous sightseeing spots! The tour will depart early in the morning, so you will have a lot of time to walk around Kyoto for the rest of the day! Hotel Monterey Kyoto is located at the heart of Kyoto city, just a 2-minute walk from Exit 6 of Karasuma-Oike Subway Station. The design of the hotel is influenced by the arts and crafts of Scotland and the old town of Edinburgh. Located at the heart of Kyoto, Hotel Monterey is perfect for both business and sightseeing guests. The guestrooms are in stylish Western-style design, and are fully equipped with modern comforts. Free WiFi & LAN are available in all guestrooms area. You can visit Kyoto's famous sightseeing spots, which are as follows: - Kinkaku-ji Temple Kinkaku-ji is Kyoto's most famous sightseeing spot and iconic sight. It is famous for its 'Golden Pavilion'. The temple is located in the middle of a pond, ant you can see the clear reflection of the temple on the surface of the pond. - Ginkaku-ji Temple Ginkaku-ji temple has enormous halls and magnificent gardens, which also has a tremendous sand garden in the middle of the temple. Ginkaku-ji is famous for its 'Silver Pavilion'. - Kiyomizu-dera Temple Kiyoizu-dera Temple is one of Kyoto's most famous sightseeing spots, which are always crowded for the whole year. Many people visit Kiyomizu-dera Temple to see the view of Kyoto city from the top of the temple, which is very beautiful. - Gion Gion is Kyoto's most famous Geisha district, and it has many top notch restaurants and izakayas. Indeed, some of the restaurants are awarded Michelin Stars for its quality. The schedule for the tour is as follows: - Day 1 6:00 - 6:55 Transfer to Tokyo station or Shinagawa station on your own. 6:00 - 6:55 Depart to Kyoto station with Nozomi Shinkansen (fastest bullet train). 8:02 - 9:08 Arrive at Kyoto Station - Day 2 Free time until departure 13:10 – 15:50 Transfer to Kyoto Station on your own. 13:10 – 15:50 Depart to Tokyo station or Shinagawa station with Nozomi Shinkansen (fastest bullet train) 15:30 – 18:20 Arrive at Tokyo station or Shinagawa station. ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Standard Ticket Delivery Ticket delivery is included in the price of your ticket. We will deliver the tickets to your hotel, and the tickets will be available for pickup from your hotel concierge when you check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We need at least 3 business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if we don't get your hotel information soon enough, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office unless you book the optional ""Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels"" service (described below). - If you are not staying at a hotel, you are required to pickup the tickets from our office. 2. Optional: Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels We offer same day ticket delivery to central Tokyo hotels if the booking is placed before 17:00 JST. The same day delivery service is only available to hotels with a concierge. The tickets will be delivered to your hotel within 3 hours of us accepting your order; please note that this does not mean the tickets are delivered within 3 hours of you placing your order. If you are interested in the same day delivery service, please also book the ""Same Day Delivery Service to Tokyo Hotels"" option with your tickets. 3. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station.
